page.title: 02 A Dairy Farm.
page.content: John Kingston of Home Farm has 150 acres all grassland.He has 140 cows of which only 90 are in milk at any one time.Breeds include Ayrshire,Fresian and crossbreed Herefords.Mr Kingston is unique in that he sells much of his milk in the village,and 1600 pints to the MMB at Oxford.Each cow produces 4 gallons daily.He only has a dairy herd. He prefers to breed his own replacements.He has 16 fields, 9 of which are for grazing and 7 are laid for hay.Hay is used for winter feeding when the cows are kept in the yard. He acquires straw bales from neighbouring farms because he does not grow any corn himself.To supplement the hay during the winter,he feeds the beasts with a special cake supplied by the BOCM of Basingstoke. Each cow receives about half a bucket full a day.
